Gene Info.Name: UGT74E2
Gene Info.Description: Encodes a UDP-glucosyltransferase, UGT74E2,  that acts on IBA (indole-3-butyric acid) and affects auxin homeostasis. The transcript and protein levels of this enzyme are strongly induced by H2O2 and may allow integration of ROS (reactive oxygen species) and auxin signaling. This enzyme can also transfer glycosyl groups to several compounds related to the explosive TNT when this synthetic compound is taken up from the environment.

Gene Info.Name: C3HC4-type RING finger
Gene Info.Description: RING/U-box superfamily protein;

Gene Info.Name: RAV2
Gene Info.Description: Rav2 is part of a complex that has been named `regulator of the (H+)-ATPase of the vacuolar and endosomal membranes' (RAVE) The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.

Gene Info.Name: GSTF7
Gene Info.Description: Encodes glutathione transferase belonging to the phi class of GSTs. Naming convention according to Wagner et al. (2002).

Gene Info.Name: GSTF6
Gene Info.Description: Encodes glutathione transferase belonging to the phi class of GSTs. Naming convention according to Wagner et al. (2002).

Gene Info.Name: CRT2
Gene Info.Description: Encodes one of three Arabidopsis calreticulins.Post-transcriptionally regulates together with CRT1 VAMP721/722 levels under ER stress.

Gene Info.Name: GSTF7
Gene Info.Description: Encodes glutathione transferase belonging to the phi class of GSTs. Naming convention according to Wagner et al. (2002).

Gene Info.Name: GSTF6
Gene Info.Description: Encodes glutathione transferase belonging to the phi class of GSTs. Naming convention according to Wagner et al. (2002).

Gene Info.Name: CRT2
Gene Info.Description: Encodes one of three Arabidopsis calreticulins.Post-transcriptionally regulates together with CRT1 VAMP721/722 levels under ER stress.

Gene Info.Name: AVP1
Gene Info.Description: Encodes a H(+)-translocating (pyrophosphate-energized) inorganic pyrophosphatase (H(+)-PPase; EC 3.6.1.1) located in the vacuolar membrane. Expression is found in all tissues examined, including meristems and floral organ primordium. Expression is particularly enhanced in pollen, and is repressed by light. Over expression and loss of function phenotypes suggest AVP1 is involved in regulation of apoplastic pH and auxin transport. The effect on auxin transport likely involves effects of extracellular pH on subcellular localization of auxin efflux carriers such as PIN1. The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.

Gene Info.Name: LHCB6
Gene Info.Description: Lhcb6 protein (Lhcb6), light harvesting complex of photosystem II.

Gene Info.Name: CAT3
Gene Info.Description: Catalase, catalyzes the breakdown of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) into water and oxygen.The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.It is a target for SUMOlaytion (PMID: 21413927).Transnitrosylates GSNOR1 and mutants suppress the gnsnor1 phenotype.

Gene Info.Name: AVP1
Gene Info.Description: Encodes a H(+)-translocating (pyrophosphate-energized) inorganic pyrophosphatase (H(+)-PPase; EC 3.6.1.1) located in the vacuolar membrane. Gene Info.Name: NAC002
Gene Info.Description: Belongs to a large family of putative transcriptional activators with NAC domain. Transcript level increases in response to wounding and abscisic acid. ATAF1 attentuates ABA signaling and sythesis. Mutants are hyposensitive to ABA. The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.

Gene Info.Name: BBX24
Gene Info.Description: Encodes salt tolerance protein (STO) which confers salt tolerance to yeast cells. Fully complements calcineurin deficient yeast but does not encode a phosphoprotein phosphatase. Sequence has similarities to CONSTANS. STO co-localizes with COP1 and plays a role in light signaling.STO transcript levels are regulated by photoperiod and phtyohormones. STO competes with FLC in the regulation of floral transition genes SOC1 and FT.

Gene Info.Name: ATNFXL1
Gene Info.Description: Encodes AtNFXL1, a homologue of the putative human transcription repressor NF-X1.  Functions as a negative regulator of the trichothecene phytotoxin-induced defense response.
